Reviews.Title: “Delightful little hotel for a convention stay”
Reviews.Author: JennyD61
Reviews.Content: I was in Montreal for a conference at the Convention Centre and spent a week staying at Le Petit Hotel. I was so glad I was staying here rather than in the big name hotels downtown where my colleagues stayed. It only took about 10 minutes to walk to the convention centre in the mornings, and when I came back I was in a great location in old Montreal for restaurants and just wandering around. I loved my week-long stay at this small boutique hotel. It combined a great location in old Montreal, an extremely comfortable and quiet room, funky decor and outstanding friendly service. Impressive features included the good continental breakfast (included) with fruit, cereals, croissants, breads and real coffee, an extremely comfortable bed, great shower and fast free wireless internet. I really liked the espresso coffee bar in the lobby staffed 24 hours a day. The staff were wonderfully helpfut and experts at suggesting the right restaurants to fit your preferences - I was really happy with all the restaurants they suggested ranging from solo dinners to groups of friends. They also looked after me very well with ice packs, carrying trays upstairs for me etc when I sprained my knee after slipping on the cobblestones. I will certainly stay here on any future visits to Montreal, for work or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTravelCat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is such a gem! You couldn't ask for a better location being close to so many restaurants and museums. We were able to check in early, and the staff were all so nice. The breakfast was great (fresh bread, fruit salad, yogurt, cereal, croissants, muffins, coffee, orange juice), and we loved that we could bring it up to our room. The room was bright, with lots of windows, storage space, a very well-stocked bar fridge (and a well-stocked depanneur right across the road), and the shower was way too much fun with all the buttons and settings. The bed was enormous and felt like sleeping in a giant pillow. You could spend an entire day just in the bed and the shower! We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Romance in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa582
Reviews.Content: Le Petit Hotel is located in the heart of Old Montreal. It is quiet and quaint and has a mix of old and new within the rooms and structure. The staff are very helpful and kind. The hotel is a short walk to shops, bars and restaurants. The rooms are small but extreemly well done and very efficient. I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: cpl8140
Reviews.Content: Great staff, location and breakfast. Get the large room, it will give you plenty of space. The breakfast wa delicious and use can use another hotel's gym that is down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff & Great location”
Reviews.Author: onionweed
Reviews.Content: Small chic hotel on great street. Many restaurants, shops, & galleries within walking distance. Staff very friendly and willing to help with anything. Rooms are small but comfortable. Would highly recommend this hotel. Parking is tough in this area recommend using their valet service if you're parking car ($28/day).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in the heart of old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Pearl657
Reviews.Content: A small unassuming hotel in a great location. The best restaurants in Montreal are either within walking distance or a short cab ride away. I stayed in the "large" room and it was very comfortable. My wife said "if it had a small kitchen , we could live here" The tv struck me as almost comically small, but we weren't there to watch tv. The hotel is owned by the same people that own Place D'Armes, another favorite of ours. The bathroom wasn't as luxurious but the room felt really comfortable, more like a small apartment. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. If they didn't have the info you needed they immediately checked the Internet and provided what you needed. We opted for the breakfast and it was perfect. Croissants, jam, fresh fruit, yogurt, coffee....what more could you ask for? The croissants are from a boulangerie on the south shore that imports butter from Belgium. We were only there for a night but were advised that we also had use of a nearby gym if needed. We did hear voices in the hall early in the morning but it and it was only conversational. It wasn't a problem, but if you are a light sleeper you might want to wear earplugs or better yet activate the nature sounds button on your clock radio. Overall a great experience. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Le Petit Hotel - Great modern design situated within Old Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: JenK20194
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel on TripAdvisor and chose it for the location in Old Montreal and the modern design. It was a perfect hotel for a girls weekend getaway to eat, drink, shop and sightsee! The staff were so helpful in making awesome dinner recommendations and reservations prior to arrival. And they truly wanted feedback on the recommendations the next day. I would definitely recommend this hotel to all and I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful :)”
Reviews.Author: Maria P
Reviews.Content: My first time in Montreal, and I booked this hotel based on recommendations from this site ad I was not disappointed. The location is just perfect and quiet in Old Montreal, a very Parisian feel, newly renovated which looks very chic & modern interior, very helpful & pleasant staff, good breakfast and the rooms were really big and bed unbelievably comfortable. I will definitely be coming back to this hotel on my next stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: simone h
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Petit Hotel after finding it in a google search. We were looking for something with a bit of character and were overjoyed when we arrived and discovered this boutique hotel is a gem. Le Petit Hotel in old Montreal is warm and inviting, with a vibrant modern colour palette and comfortable furnishings. It is small, but quiet, for a restful night's sleep. A French-style breakfast is included and just the thing to kick start your day. The staff were so helpful and friendly - happy to direct us to locally loved cafes, restaurants and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Staff - modern facility”
Reviews.Author: Ryan P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights and had a very pleasant experience. Great service, facility and location. Will definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem in old Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: SaskatchewanMag5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The rooms are tiny but very clean and the bed is extremely comfortable. A breakfast was served every morning consisting of delicious croissants, fruit, yogurt and assorted breads as well as wonderful types of coffees. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. The location of the hotel is near to Notre Dame Cathedral and many restaurants and the waterfront. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB”
Reviews.Author: dereck_bown
Reviews.Content: Superb reception, staff and service, Good value. very atmospheric rooms - great location amongst restaurants. Simple french breakfast so you need to head out if you want stomething more substantial - but still great croissants

Reviews.Title: “Little hotel. Big comfort.”
Reviews.Author: jetsgozoom
Reviews.Content: After reading the positive reviews and scouring the photos on Oyster.com we decided to give Le Petit a try and it did not disappoint. My wife and I stayed in a spacious room on the fourth floor which had cathedral ceilings that added positively to the airy feel. The bed was enormous and one of the best we've slept on in any hotel. Apart from a little neighbourly noise next door during one of our nights there (not necessarily an indication that the walls aren't sound-proofed enough), we slept soundly. The showers were large and offered several massaging jets which was a bonus. The water pressure was decent but not strong in the sink, but that proved a minor hiccup. We don't require a gym or business centre so simply having solid Wi-Fi, a flat-screen TV and an iPod doc proved enough creature comforts for us. Especially since we don't have cable at home. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Having fresh pastry and strong coffee sent to our door in the mornings didn't hurt either. A real treat. I've been to Montreal dozens of times and this was the best hotel I've stayed at. Even with the weather being as cold as it was, being surround by the beauty of Old Montreal proved a great equalizer. My wife and I recommend this petite hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Le Petit and Montreal-a perfect combination”
Reviews.Author: tituspaddler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, plus a friend stayed, alas for only one night, in February. We chose both the extra large and medium rooms. Both were well designed but the extra large room was special-charming and relaxing. Location of the hotel is superb for visiting the old city and beyond. All staff were most helpful with reservations, parking the car and making us feel like welcome guests. We enjoyed visiting the museum of archeology-right around the corner from the hotel-and lots of great restaurants within walking distance. Le Petit is truly a special place and I'm so glad we found it... thanks of course to trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Just Another Excellent Rating...”
Reviews.Author: Dano515
Reviews.Content: My wife and i traveled to Montreal for a belated Valentine's Day weekend getaway and chose Le Petit Hotel as our place to call home over two nights. We based our decision on the reviews from Tripadvisor and quickly realized why the hotel was so highly rated. We arrived at Le Petit Hotel on Friday night and the check-in process was a breeze. From the onset, the staff at the desk were incredibly welcoming, consistent with all of the reviews that we had read. The hotel offers valet parking at a rate of $25/night, which I found reasonable so as not to worry about it for the weekend. We were situated on the 3rd floor, in room 302, at the back of the building. The room itself was remarkable. We opted for the medium room, which offered us more than enough space for the couple of days we were in Montreal. The bathroom was big for a boutique hotel with an awesome shower and great Aveda products. The room itself was gorgeous. The walls were comprised of exposed brick and the floors were hardwood. There was a sizable desk and a wonderfully stylish (and comfortable) chair in the corner for reading. There were double windows, which opened in full, allowing the crisp winter air to fill the room. I must make this next point clear: Believe the hype about the bed, it was really, really comfortable. I don't know that I've ever slept in a more comfortable bed. Lastly, there was an ipod dock/stereo, which I found to be a great feature. Your stay will come with a complimentary breakfast, which was excellent. Croissants, chocolate croissants, homemade breads, fruit, cereals, and wonderful coffee-drinks were all options each morning. In past experiences in Montreal, as is the case in most major cities, the staff of hotels and other establishments come off as a bit pretentious. This is not the case at Le Petit Hotel. The staff was not only helpful, but welcoming. They answered all of our questions and quickly new what we would enjoy doing in the city based on our interests. The great thing about the staff is that they weren't suit and tie type folks; this group was young, cool, and obviously up on what was happening in the city. A great group... The location of the hotel was pretty perfect as well. While we didn't spend much time down in the old-port area, the neighborhood had plenty of nice things to look at (the architecture mainly) and gave way to easy access to the Metro. The only knock I would give this hotel is that the walls seemed a bit thin. On our first night, our neighbors left their room with their ipod on. As my wife and I tried to fall asleep, we were kept awake by the sounds of the awful musical tastes of our neighbors. However, when I called the desk, they were extremely helpful and very understanding. They responded to my request immediately and remedied the situation. I guess you really cant ask for more when a situation like this comes up. All in all, I think that Le Petit Hotel is more than worthy of all the Tripadvisor hype. The hotel is small, stylish, warm, and inviting. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl604
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at Le Petit Hotel. We loved the location in the heart of the old town. The front desk were friendly and helpful about things to do and places to eat. I can't give it 5 stars only because the breakfast was very average - although the coffee was wonderful. Also, the key was very sensitive and sometimes you had to swipe the card 10 or more times before it worked. I told the front desk about it because I thought maybe we just needed a new key, but they had heard this complaint before and explained you just have to be patient. And to their credit they did walk back up to the room with me and show me a better technique- but it was still a hassle. The bed was VERY comfortable and overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Warm & Stylish”
Reviews.Author: maximos e
Reviews.Content: We visited "le petit hotel" on a business trip a few months ago without having seen any reviews previously.Reading these reviews now, I m not surprised at all!It was indeed one of the coziest hotel we have ever visited, very stylish and with very a professional team running it. A good example of how luxury boutique hotels should be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, location and value”
Reviews.Author: Ty O
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed here for a weekend in January, 2012. The location was excellent and close to the metro. The concierge was friendly, accomodating and knowledgeable about the surrounding area as well as other locations in Montreal. He was able to set up a couples massage at a local spa for us as well which was easy and appreciated. It was booked for 5:30, and when we came down from our room at 5:10, he already had directions (walking - 5 minutes) to the spa printed out, highlighted and ready to go. As well, the price is exceptional for the value of service provided. No major chain hotel in Vieux-port (or anywhere!) would provide complimentary breakfast with exceptional local breads, croissants and espressos/lattes etc AND deliver it to your room upon your request (AWESOME breakfast in bed!!!). I can't wait to return to this intimate, well placed, and service-priority auberge!

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: CarrieB76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in Jan 2012. Having travelled around the world numerous times, I could safely say this is one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed at. My top points would be the location, the service, our room (large) and the breakfast as well as the friendly and very helpful staff. Having stayed at the Shangri La, Kowloon on this same trip, I would say I preferred this hotel to the large impersonal hotel. Also, although we were paying for a premium harbour view room in the Shangri La, no breakfast was included. Le Petit Hotel had a beautiful fresh continental breakfast included in our nightly rate. The coffee was wonderful as well as the fresh fruit salad, yogurts and fresh croissants daily. Our large room was positively wonderful, had a huge king bed with beautiful fresh white linen & robes, slippers, the works! I would not hesitate to stay here again, or to recommend this little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, comfortable, friendly - a great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ElleGrrl
Reviews.Content: This place is an excellent choice for Old Montreal. Our room (a medium, only $20 more than a small) was super-comfortable and plenty roomy for two. The stylish design of the room gives it a much more expensive feel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Room service is from an excellent restaurant down the street. And the bed... best bed ever!! I highly recommend Let Petit Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with helpful staff. Rooms clean with beds which were really comfy.”
Reviews.Author: Pepysp
Reviews.Content: Great location. Modern sleek and smart. Just like being in Paris, but downtown old Montreal. Room was fine although I had to turn up the heat as it was very cold. But then it was -15c outside. Room was clean and bed comfy. Breakfast was ok and I would defiantly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: Red_Apron_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: I hesitate to do this because I consider this hotel the my best kept secret, but they deserve to be acknowledged for their friendly and helpful staff, their great coffee bar, their fresh continental breakfasts (included), their tastefully appointed rooms and their comfortable beds - the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. After two stays there, it is unlikely I will stay anywhere else. Keep up the great work and please don't get so popular that I can't get a reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: WldTrvlrmtl
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay. The rooms are incredibly clean and functional and the staff is so friendly. Definitely a great place to stay in old Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oceanbeat
Reviews.Content: Beautiful boutique hotel in the heart of Old Montreal. The room was spacious and tastefully decorated combining the charm of the old architecture with a very modern touch. Location is superb, however if you have a street view room, it can be very noisy at night as one of the most popular bar/club in Montreal is just across the street. The breakfast was included and was delicious. Overall the staff was very attentive and hotel was a hit. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great XMas”
Reviews.Author: FrenchyC77
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. Very nice little hotel in old montreal. The staff was very good to us and they make a good latte early in the am. The room was quiet and clean. Just out the door you will find multiple restaurants in all price range.

Reviews.Title: “Both modern and traditional at the same time, friendly staff and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Octomann
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here, it was well worth the price. The rooms were modern for a change, with comfy beds and don't get me started with the fantastic shower. The breakfast was great including chocolate croissants, and the staff were all helpful when needed. The location was very central to everywhere we needed to go, and the hotel took care of parking our car in their private lot. Bottom line: everything you can want and more, and a great location where you can ditch your car and walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in old town Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: jme2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for 5 nights mid November. This is a fabulous hotel, small, quaint, modern and perfectly clean. Plus friendly and helpful staff. Lots of great restaurants right on same street, but the better restaurants are to the left when walking out front door. Highly recommended small hotel, we chose this as other options in old town are either very large or very expensive. Our rate also included a great breakfast (including wonderful lattes) and complimentary wifi. The photos on their website are exactly what it looks like...so no surprises! I will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ArdecheOttawa
Reviews.Content: Wonderful boutique hotel in Old Montreal with attentive and charming staff. Breakfast is served in a lovely space with a great assortment of foods. Hotel room felt like a small condo! The King bed is extremely comfortable. So looking forward to returning. Great restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Ybread
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two night. The room is pretty good and the bed was very comfortable. The best thing about this hotel is the service. All staffs were so kind and very helpful. I really enjoyed my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Quaint and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Stepha44
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel!! My sister and I had a "Large" room #201 and it was amazing!! It totally exceeded our expectations. The staff was top notch! Jennifer and Philippe were so helpful and gave us wonderful recommendations. Philippe even made us a reservation at Restaurant Holder which was perfect!! Our room was beautiful and spotless. The bed was so comfortable that it made it hard to motivate. Awesome shower as well. The location is perfect, right in the heart of old town. About a 20 minute walk to downtown. The breakfast was also amazing!! Croissants, fresh fruit salad, muffins, cereal, espresso, cappuccinos, yogurt and fresh baked bread. I will definitely be staying here again next time I am in Montreal!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Bitterfly
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at Le Petit for 2 nights. Amazing would be just the word to describe everything - location, staff, breakfast. We would love to be back.

Reviews.Title: “Le Petite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anne G
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Le Petite Hotel. The front desk staff/ concierges were spectacular- everyone of them. The location was perfectly sighted in the middle of Vieux-Montreal, and literally a ton of great restaurants in the same block and surrounding area. We would definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep at Le Petite And Get Out Of Old Town for the rest of the day”
Reviews.Author: barry10028
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay at Le Petite was relaxing. From the moment we walked through their door, way before check in, after an early flight, Jennifer and everyone else working the front desk throughout our stay was kind, helpful, efficient and polite. Maybe it was the fact that the lobby doubles as an espresso bar? Maybe it was the upgrade to the larger room at no extra charge? (more on that in a moment.) Whatever the reason, my wife and I were instantly comfortable upon first contact with Le Petite Hotel. As to that "upgrade". I had read a number of reviews on Trip Advisor warning against getting a room that fronts the street due to noise late at night when bars and restaurant's close. While I had kept that in the back of my mind on my virtual 'to do' list, I never got around to requesting a quieter room and when Jennifer presented us with our free upgrade I instantly calculated the hotel was full, too many people had requested quiet rooms and we were the schmo's getting moved to the front. While all of that is probably the reason for our upgrade, we also happen to live in New York City and the noise we hear from our window everyday would drown out a thousand Rue St. Paul Streets. As it turned out, there was a bit of noise for a brief period around 11pm, but it was transient and did not effect my ability to sleep better for two nights in a row than I have for months in my own bed. We loved the decor of the room. Real stone and brick. The energy efficient lighting takes a few moments to get to full power, but once there we had plenty of light. The bathroom was well done with a light beige textured wall tile and porcelain "wood style" flooring. The glass sink was nice to look at but the more you use it, the more you realize it's not the kind of thing you'd want in your own home. What you would want in your home is the shower hardware featuring dual body jets stretching from waist to chest level. When set just right, you get the shower spray from above and either four mists or four jets -- your choice -- in any combo you desire. That in and of itself was a mini vacation inside our two day mini vacation. Breakfast in the morning was also great. They make a terrific Cafe Latte, smaller than you might get at a specialty shop, but well made. And their assortment of croissants, cereals, yogurts and fruit was more than enough for us. Brewed coffee and juice are also available, but be sure to ask your server for the juice as it is not sitting out on the breakfast bar. The staff was also helpful to us and all when it came time to plan dinner or find a show to see or simply get directions to the other parts of town. And that is our takeaway from this visit. Because as terrific as Le Petite Hotel is and as quaint as the streets of Old Montreal are, that area has clearly become nothing more than a tourist trap of very expensive restaurants, art and antique shops and souvenir stores. The real Montreal, as we found out, is one Metro Day pass and any subway stop you choose to take, away. Stay at Le Petite Hotel. But get out of Old Town as early and often as you can.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: Susan B
Reviews.Content: All the rave reviews are true. This unique little hotel was perfect for our stay, from the fresh breakfasts to the modern room decor, housed in a 19th century building with stone walls and wide wooden beams. To a person, the staff was hospitable, enthusiastic and extremely well-informed about the beautiful city of Montreal. The location couldn't be better. Windows that open for as much fresh air as you want. And the most luxurious, comfortable bed, pillows and bedding, ever! Thank you for a wonderful stay. We will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Best Area of Old City”
Reviews.Author: Maxwell E
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel in the old city just for two nights to check out Montreal. We found it is an American Express travel guide. Everything was great. The staff is really helpful. They will help you select sights to see and help arrange for dinner reservations. The hotel is in the best area of the old city near everything to see. The city is really walkable, so getting around is easy, and they have a reasonable parking rate. They offer a nice morning breakfast Overall, perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Vicki L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and had a great stay from the time that we entered the front door. The reception staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms, although a bit on the small side by North American standards, were great....great design, stylish, comfortable, clean, and large windows in our room that opened to let in fresh air at night. The breakfast was delicious. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Chic boutique in great location!”
Reviews.Author: sanderson_72
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, but decent size room, very unique, great service, and healthy breakfast included. Loved it, walk everywhere, fabulous decor, so happy I chose this unique property.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: hensmyth
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel--great location, super helpful/friendly staff, great breakfast and coffee, clean rooms, the works! Everyone there really helped enrich our visit to Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Le Petit Hotel c'est ca...Small time”
Reviews.Author: KMPSK2011
Reviews.Content: Great location in Old Montreal--close to the Metro, the old port and downtown. Also, relatively quiet location. Room was very spacious and bed, complete with down duvet, pillows and feather bed was very comfortable. Room cleanliness was lacking: there was mildew in the shower and mud on the wall. Also, there was very poor lighting in our suite. The corridor leading to the bathroom was like the batcave. Also, the bathroom itself was a bit of a disappointment. It was small and there was only one hook for towels, robes, sleepwear shower kits etc. We chose to stay at a Boutique hotel for a more personalized approach to our stay. We read the reviews of the excellent staff recommendations for shops, restaurants etc, but unfortunately this was not our experience. We arrived at 11pm on a Thursday and were hungry from our travels. The only recommendations the front desk staff had for food, as there is none in the evenings at the hotel, was to try a local pub (closed), wander into chinatown (at midnight!), or to order from Domino's. Domino's in Montreal!! Really!! If you want experienced service, knowledgeable and helpful staff I would recommend looking at a more well established boutique hotel. PS: Having to go downstairs for a coffee or a tea all the time is annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay if you want to walk all of old montreal”
Reviews.Author: Dvbdmd
Reviews.Content: Nice boutique hotel with attentive and friendly staff who are eager to help with anything you may need during your stay. The staff booked a reservation for us at the famed Garde Manger restaurant a month in advance, which is no easy task. Most important thing I look for in a hotel is the location. You can walk to every restaurant in old Montreal easily. A cab ride to another part of the city is about 15 bucks. Cabs are easily hailed right outside the hotel nightly if you are so inclined, but with the 20 or so restaurants at your door, you may not even want to leave the neighborhood. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to stay within all the action of old Montreal. One thing, Sunday's are basically a dead day here. Nothing opens until the late afternoon, of at all.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: MaurerFischer
Reviews.Content: We just spent a weekend at Le Petit Hotel - 5 of us in total, 3 rooms - and all absolutely loved it. It's in an ideal location, in the heart of Old Montreal, near the Old Port so you can walk everywhere, including the best restaurants in Montreal. The concierge and staff could not have been more helpful - especially as none of us had ever been to Montreal. The restaurants that they recommended and helped book for us were exactly what we were looking for. The lobby and rooms are modern and beautiful and the hotel offers a great breakfast. No need to book anywhere else...

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: dbenson441
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to downtown Montreal for business (or pleasure) do yourself a favor and forego the knee-jerk reaction to stay at the Intercontinental or Westin (for those of you who may be attending a metting at the Convention Center) and book your stay at the Le Petit Hotel, just a few blocks walk from the Center. Located on rue St-Paul this htoel has the "old" outside look of a Parisian building but inside one will find an extremely clean and modern facility. The rooms are well-appointed with adequate space and modern bathroom (shower only...but great shower!). The bed may have been the most comfortable one I've ever slept in during my 35+ years of business travel. If location is important, this hotel has it. You are within walking distance of some very fine dining spots, all surrounded by the feel of a Parisian neighborhood. Add in free internet, a Continental breakfast...excellent bread, croissants (would you expect any less?), jam, fresh fruit, yogurt, coffee, juice...do you really need more? All this at a price substantially less than the "big chains." "I'll be back"...lol.

Reviews.Title: “Fall Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: Angela T
Reviews.Content: We just had a very lovely honeymoon stay in Le Petit Hotel. The location was prime - right in Old Montreal, on a cute street with a bunch of restaurants and boutiques. The hotel was a tiny bit hard to find, but only because we were looking for a sign and there wasn't one - just the name of the hotel on the windows. The staff took our car for valet, and kept it for the whole four-day stay. The lobby, cafe and eating-area are small, but stylish and well-decorated. I could easily see someone choosing to sit with a book or a laptop there (although we didn't because we had lots of sights to see!). The room was very nice. We were on the fourth floor in a "medium" room, which was fairly spacious for two people with lots of closet room, a desk, a comfy chair, two night stands and a king-sized bed. Our window was facing the wall of the adjacent building, so not much of a view, but it meant that we had a very quiet stay with no noise or light problems. The bathroom was a little cramped, but it was no problem for us and the amenities were nice, including the Aveda bath products and the shower with all sorts of strange options. The mini-bar is limited, but reasonably priced. It was a very clean hotel on the whole, and the maid service tidied up the room daily, replaced the towels and set the iHome music player/alarm clock to a soft trance music. The room, even on the fourth floor, had very good (and free!) wifi service. The continental breakfast was a nice start to the day, and it's sad that more hotels these days don't offer it. The options were limited, but the quality was very good. Plain and chocolate croissants, fresh breads for toasting, cereal, yogurt, fruit and coffee/tea. The staff would also come around and offer to get you orange juice or a fresh latte. Not a stuff-yourself breakfast, but perfect to keep you going until lunchtime. The service was, in a word, excellent. The staff was always pleasant and prompt with any requests, and personable while also being professional. Check-in and check-out were both fast, as was the valet. The provided us with maps, directions, called us a taxi, and gave excellent restaurant recommendations and made reservations. They remembered who we were and asked us specific questions about how our day had been and whether we liked the restaurants, etc. It was a nice benefit to being in a smallish hotel. If (when?) I return to Montreal, I will definitely be choosing Le Petit Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tres chic petit hotel! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Gigi729
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were Honeymooning in Quebec. We loved this small boutique hotel. Great location on a quiet street filled with galleries and boutiques. We entered our large room to find cupcakes awaiting us with a note of congratulations! The room was clean and stylish. I am employed by and usually stay at Four Seasons Hotels. I was very impressed by Le Petit Hotel's personable staff and attention to detail. At one point we noticed we were out of tissues. We called the front desk and they delivered another box in less than 30 seconds. The breakfast included in our stay was delicious; fresh fruit, croissants, yogurt. Great expresso drinks, too! I also appreciate having a thermostat in the room to make myself comfortable. It was a deal for about $200/ night. I would go back in a heart beat. Only a few minor suggestions...The dim fluorescent lighting in the bathroom made applying make-up a bit depressing. A rug in the room would soften and warm the somewhat sterile decor.

Reviews.Title: “Very central, very clean”
Reviews.Author: MBlaha
Reviews.Content: A beautiful small hotel with modern design. Very clean rooms and perfect location right in the centre of Old Town. Our first room on the 4th floor was quite spacious, but the AC in this room was terribly loud. When we complained about that, we were given a new room immediately - as it seemed, we were not the first guests realizing that air con problem... Our new room was smaller, but at least with a quiet AC. Staff ist very helpful and polite, breakfast is ok. For the size of the (second) room, though, the price was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tdl119
Reviews.Content: Nice little boutique hotel located right on Rue St. Paul in old Montreal. Rooms are small but comfortable. Good value at around $200, which includes continental breakfast and internet service. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great room!”
Reviews.Author: Crunchers
Reviews.Content: Le Petit is not a budget hotel, but fairly priced given it's location and class. We paid around $200 (US) for a beautiful, quiet, 2x room. We've had friends stay at pricier Montreal digs who were underwhelmed with their experience. LPH has awesome and helpful staff, & the rooms have the best bedding ever! They're located right in the heart of Old Montreal, but not too close to all the tourist crap down Rue St-Paul. Nice Breafast included!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome littel boutique hotel. Highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: alifrieri
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for family and couples. The staff were superb, catering to our needs and very helpful. The rooms are slick and contemporary! And the breakfast was delicious! I would definitely recommend this and can't wait till our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great and well-located”
Reviews.Author: Bon1111
Reviews.Content: Situated on the main walking street in Old Montreal. Staff very friendly and helpful.Continental breakfast nice. Coffee bar always available. Comfy bed.

Reviews.Title: “Le Petit Hotel is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: MHardy3023
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on the recommendation of family members who stayed there in October 2010. Nothing but great things to say about the hotel. I never thought I'd enjoy a small hotel (it's only 24 rooms) but this hotel surpassed our expectations. The front desk personnel were very knowledgable; the rooms were immaculate and original; the location was superb. So close to the View Port of Montreal as well as downtown part. We could walk around and then rest and then go back out again; felt very safe there. I'd stay there again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Staff, Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dan08054
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a 2 night interlude in Montreal during a trip to Vermont. It was our first overnight trip to Montreal in many years, and based upon the recommendation of a family member, we chose Le Petit HÃ´tel. As we checked in, we realized the location was perfect, in the heart of Old Montreal. But that was just the beginning. During our brief stay, multiple staff members provided us with insights and recommendations regarding dining, shopping and touring. They all truly know and love Montreal, and they took time to ensure that we found what was of interest to us. We stayed in a "medium" room, which was adequate in size, and the modern decor was very inviting. It made a very nice contrast with the old style architecture of the building. The shower was superb, with side panels containing four adjustable jets to complement the large overhead fixture. Finally, breakfast was amazing. The pastries, particularly the croissants, were fresh and plentiful, along with cereals, yogurt, and fruit. And lattes and cappuccinos were served in addition to the coffee and tea. We tend to prefer boutique hotels over the large chains, but this truly sets a standard that is not easily matched elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful boutique hotel situated perfectly”
Reviews.Author: Mike28a
Reviews.Content: We went to Montreal for a day bike ride and stayed at Le Petit Hotel on the recommendation of a friend of ours. We were immensely impressed by the staff, who eagerly helped us with our bikes and gear and took care of our car. The room was nicely outfitted and the king bed was perfect. You can walk to fifty restaurants in five minutes (We visited Bocata while on this stay) and all of the old town and port are right outside your door. The lobby cafe serves excellent espresso-based drinks and the included breakfast had some of the nicest bread we have ever eaten. We will return to stay here as it really couldn't be topped. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “I Highly Recommend This "Small" Gem”
Reviews.Author: Divinejudge1
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the nicest small hotels in Montreal. The location is great and they have valet parking which was a benefit since I arrived w/ a car from New York City. The staff was extremely friendly, very informative, and all seemed like knowledgeable locals that love their city of Montreal. I was really impressed with the service and the help. I highly recommend the XL Room mine was 208 and it had a king bed large window. I also noticed a Nintendo Wii. However I was impressed with the dual flush toilet and shower panel. If I return I do plan a repeat stay at Le Petit HÃ´tel. It was a great experience and awesome room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Little Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amandakr
Reviews.Content: Montreal is the perfect retreat for a girl's weekend and Le Petit Hotel was the perfect temporary residence. The king room was spacious and comfortable, quiet and cozy. The bathroom was great with an amazing shower that I could have moved into. But the absolute best thing about the hotel was the staff. All Montrealers who loved their city, they went out of their way to recommend places that weren't the local tourist trap down the way. Every last restaurant recommendation was great. The location of the hotel is perfect, easy access to everything. Definitely make sure that you get out to the neighbors that make up Montreal, though. There is definitely more to see than just old town. The food markets are a lot of fun.....the Bixi bike rental system is perfect for the city.....the museums are great....restaurants are fantastics and Montrealers are unbelievably friendly.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Houston, TX USA and Doha, Qatar
Reviews.Title: “Everything was great.”
Reviews.Author: DohaSessions
Reviews.Content: I can't really add but just agree with all the previous positive comments. The hotel is great. Great location, super great staff, great breakfast. The room was small but neat, clean, and adequate. The bed was huge, comfy, and wonderful. The bathroom was small but the shower was large. There was no place to put a suitcase which would have been nice but there was ample closet space for our clothes. I really can't say enough about the staff. There were about 6 guys on a rotation during our 5 night stay and each was as helpful and friendly as the last. They were always cheerful and enthusiastic to help with questions, service, recommendation, and reservations around town. We have traveled all over the world and I think this may be the very best hotel experience we have ever had. Often almost everything is good and then there is something that goes wrong or just isn't right. Not here. It's all perfect. Book early. I think this one is going to get hard to book into as word gets out. I know I will be telling my friends. Some specifics. The location is perfect. We could just walk one block down and we were on the canal were we ran two mornings and took a long bike ride another. Walking down the street to the left revealed many lovely restaurants just a few blocks off the tourist track. A few blocks to the right and you are right in the middle of the tourist action. A few block straight into town and there is a large subway stop going all over town. It is at the center of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel with a super location”
Reviews.Author: ishmeal
Reviews.Content: We loved the tasteful restoration of one of the oldest buildings in Montreal. Staff were very accommodating and helpful. The room was very modern, but the exposed stone and beams preserved the historic character. For access to transportation and walking the old city it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The Loveliest hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: GraceCarr
Reviews.Content: Small and intimate. Charming decor and incredible staff, The rooms are one of a kind and very unique. Lovely continental breakfast with the best coffee and the freshest baked goods. The location is ideal, right in the heart of Old Montreal. Walking distance to excellent restaurants and boutiques. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Designerly and healthy”
Reviews.Author: paligoy
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful place, showing off the old Montreal stone walls, stripped bare, and then layered back up with designerly touches, like the street art mural in the breakfast area. It's also less than a block from the local history museum, the parks on the wharf, and several good restaurants. Breakfast was what you'd expect to find at a cafÃ©: healthy breads and spreads, fresh berries and yogurt, and good rich espressos.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: BachinBaltimore
Reviews.Content: My husband and I highly recommend Le Petit Hotel. Though in the heart of Old Montreal, the hotel is very peaceful. It's located on a street filled with great restaurants and a pedestrian mall-type area, with shops, arts, and cafes, all in easy walking distance. The harbor area is 1 block away. Le Petit Hotel, as a boutique hotel, gives very personalized attention to their guests, like restaurant recommendations and making reservations. The hotel has wi-fi, but we didn't bring a laptop. When we inquired if there was an Internet cafe nearby, they let us use their netbook! That epitomizes how good the service is there. Our room was clean, comfortable, and modern -- with good a/c, even during very hot late-July. A good breakfast in the morning: a variety of bakery items (including chocolate pain and croissants), fresh fruit, cereal, and yogurt. Coffee and tea (for free) is available all the time. We'd recommend this place to any of our friends and will stay there again when we take another trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Atlanta_GALuv2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and enjoyed it immensely! Our room was a large room and was exceptional....clean and so very comfortable! The staff are so friendly, accommodating and had great recommendations. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and would most definitely stay here next time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mateobru
Reviews.Content: I stayed for nights in Montreal at le petit hotel. From my arrival to the end of my stay all staff was very friendly and helpful. My room on the second floor was big , well equipped and comfortable. The breakfast served in the morning was very good but perhaps lacked some cheese. The hotel is conveniently located in the old MontrÃ©al and at a close distance of the subway that takes you anywhere. i used the gym at sister hotel the Nelligan, a 5 minutes walk from le petit hotel I also had lunch on the Nelligan terrace that offers nice views on the city and a good affordable lunch menu.

Reviews.Title: “We were truly pleased with our stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Arch_11
Reviews.Content: The room, the reception area, the breakfast, and the location the hotel could not have been better. And we enjoyed the coffee and newspapers in the reception area., The front desk staff was cheerful and welcoming, and went to a great deal of a trouble to help us when we asked about access to the Metro and the location of a couple of restaurants that had been recommended to us.

Reviews.Title: “European feel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Twogreynomads
Reviews.Content: On a quaint, narrow street this hotel sits. Nice walks to everything. Wonderful lobby to hang and street watch, chat, or catch up on e-communications. We enjoyed our top floor, contemporary dormer room; very adequate for our needs--lovely natural light. The bathroom was on the cozy side, but the multi-jetted shower was perfect. The room felt as though we were staying in a home, rather than a hotel, which we enjoyed. Simple, tasty, variety breakfast provided. WiFi. Staff very approachable and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, bills extras after checkout”
Reviews.Author: JaneLacey
Reviews.Content: This was a good little hotel in old town Montreal. Staff on site is very helpful. Parking is expensive. Rooms are good and comfortable. Great location. They did charge us after we had left for some chocolates we never ate. Watch your credit card bills after you check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Agent704
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Montreal and Le Petit was he perfect choice. The location is ideal for exploring Old Montreal and enjoying the restaurants in that area. The hotel is very conveniently located near the bike path so we could easily get in a run along the river/canal enjoying a delicious coffee back and breakfast. Subway is just a few blocks away providing access to other parts of the city (we enjoyed shopping and restaurants along Saint Denis!). The staff was very friendly and willing to help with directions, dinner suggestions, and umbrellas. We will definitely stay here when we come back!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: TJBCT
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at Le Petit Hotel and we would definitely return. The rooms are clean, modern, and the hotel is beautiful. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast is included and the croissants are fresh and delicious. Definitely nicer than staying at a commercial hotel. Old Montreal is great and the hotel is in a great area of the old town. Excellent restaurants just steps from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MaryJane03
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the "small" rooms. We found it compact, but not cramped. There was so much closet space, and the room was so well designed that we found it comfortable for the two of us. The price made it an excellent value with all the included amenities. As others have stated, the staff is excellent! They are there to help without hovering. The breakfast was something we looked forward to each morning. We were grateful to all the other reviewers who let us know about this gem! The location is perfect for those touring Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, very noisey at night”
Reviews.Author: JoolsDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: I would agree with everything positive the previous reviewers have said including beautiful, chic, fantastic staff, wonderful shower, fab breakfast, in the heart of the old city, close to wonderful restaurants. However be aware that Rue St Paul boasts many bars and clubs and the noise in the street went on until after 03.30 for the 3 nights we were there. If this doesn't bother you, it's a great place to stay and I would highly recommend it. If it's an issue, look for somewhere quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Best night sleep ever.”
Reviews.Author: danielle_leblanc
Reviews.Content: So much character in this building. Rooms were very clean and cozy. Beds are AMAZING! So comfy, you just want to stay in bed all day. Located in old Montreal, short distance from Metro station, cute restaurants and more. Friendly staff, free breakfast,(tasty and fresh), free WiFi, and more. A little pricey, but if your reason for traveling is to relax, then it's worth every penny. (I suggest the Medium size room, it has a King size bed). I will definitely be staying at Le Petit Hotel again for my next trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lindsasaurus
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a very nice stay at Le Petit Hotel. PROS Getting to the hotel from the airport was easy on the 747 bus. Check in was smooth and the room was ready early. We thought the hotel was very clean and the room was a good size. The bed was VERY comfortable and I loved that they had a full size professional style hair dryer. Breakfast was nice. Toast, fruit, yogurt, cereal and coffee. Friendly staff. Shower was great. WiFi was fast. CONS Even though the staff was very friendly they weren't very organized. They were unable to book us a dinner reservation. However, we were able to walk into the restaurant we wanted to go to. They over charged us for the room but they credited us back the difference because I had a print out of my confirmation. The central air (heater/AC) in the room was sometimes loud and made funny noises.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: vitsippor
Reviews.Content: The location are brilliant and close to wonderful restaurants like L'Orignal an DNA. The staff is so helpful and kind. The rooms are gorgeous and spacious and their showers are the best of any hotel I've been in. I stay here every time I go to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, great location and great service.”
Reviews.Author: benthestudent
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for my honeymoon. From the minute we walked in the door, we were greeted with great friendly service. The room was beautiful with the most comfy bed and amazing shower. I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody. Thanks for making our stay and honeymoon memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice place, nice breakfast poor breakfsat room”
Reviews.Author: JPB20
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. The rooms are nice and comfortable. They lacked naturall light and view. The bath room was clean as the remainer of the room but somewhat small. We could have enjoyed some more room to put our stuff on in it. We found the continental breakfast good yet me missed some natural arome less and not fat free yougurt. The breakfast room was small, in a cold corner with noisy chairs and table: not sympathetic at all unlike the remainder of the whole hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: CsCs11
Reviews.Content: Just returned to New York after a lovely one night stay at the hotel. First off, I arrived exhausted and a wonderful member of the staff brought tea and some fruit up to my room. I was in town for a very brief visit but I travel often for work and this kind of care and attention to guests was very appreciated. It was a small gesture, but I appreciated it. Other than that, I found my room comfortable, loved the bed and the sheets. The bathrooms have Aveda products and bathrobes and slippers. So it is very cozy, comfortable and chic. Lovely visit, and I would love to go back when I have more time, and hopefully bring my husband on the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel... stay here when you can...”
Reviews.Author: DZuki111
Reviews.Content: This the cutest hotel in the area with just a touch of class! Lovely Euro breakfast in the morning (chocolate croissants!) and the concierge literally helped me book ever restaurant i ate at with delight and smiles. Even helped me find an english cinema to check out a movie.. very nice rooms (view was a bit odd; directly into the next window of a business building. twas nice to wave the nice man in the morning. comfortable beds and a very cool rain mist shower. loved it. stay here. now.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good about Le Petit Hotel--great stay.”
Reviews.Author: orizu
Reviews.Content: Le Petit hotel is what all small boutique hotels should aspire to, namely great service, good location, spotless modern decor, layered with a good casual vibe-- a solid value. Hardwood floors in the room, which had a slight, pleasant scent of cedar are a great euro touch-- no worries of unsanitary hotel carpets! Bedding was top quality, though as mentioned in another TA review, on the soft side. Despite being downtown with exposed granite walls and the floor to ceiling windows, the rooms were remarkably quiet. The bathroom in the medium room is a little crowded, with towels stored under the clear glass sink, but an acceptable compromise as the greater portion of the room is given over to the large shower enclosure. The complimentary breakfast included excellent croissants and chocolatines as well as fruit youghurt and cereal. The staff was great, casual yet friendly. One of the nicer perks was the cafe/ check in desk where you can get an real espresso--not the pod nonsense--at anytime of day.

Reviews.Title: “A warm hotel in cold wintery Montreal”
Reviews.Author: walkinglola
Reviews.Content: The service by the hip and knowledgeable young staff, was fantastic. My husband and I spent a short but cold time in wintery Montreal, but always felt soothed heading back to our this warm hotel, and the interesting modern room. The cappucinos were outstanding and the morning continental plenty. Thank you for a wonderful time and we look forward to visiting again. Mille mercis!

Reviews.Title: “Some issues”
Reviews.Author: TokyoShibumi
Reviews.Content: Great spot, great looking rooms, nice staff, etc., but sometimes it seems the place is run by high school kids doing a school project. Everyone is very eager to help, but no one really functions together and the result is chaos! Example, I was trying to check out, but three staff were too busy serving a walk-in customer ordering a coffee and croissant to attend to me! They need a proper reception area--which would mean moving the impromptu cafe to the back of the hotel. Rooms need better sound-proofing. Still, great locale and cool rooms. you decide.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: travelcatadk
Reviews.Content: This is a sweet little hotel. The service was fantastic, and the location right in the heart of Old Montreal can't be beat. We booked the small room, which is indeed small. My only critique is that the room needed to be touched up a bit--the walls had a lot of scuff marks and the overhead lamp had a crack in it. Felt a bit worn. Breakfast was good. Loved the chocolate croissant. It's a bit on the pricey side--we have stayed in the Latin Quarter and the Plateau for less. But it was lovely walking the nearly empty streets of early Jan in the snow. We also visited the Scandanavian Baths, right around the corner. Highly recommend that experience.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Esprit - Trendy with Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: crocon
Reviews.Content: I absolutely fell in love with this hotel. Very chic, and trendy with old world charm. This is a small, hip hotel without all the amenities of a chain but with a local flavor that's hard to beat. The staff is exceptionally helpful, gracious and friendly, more than willing to spend time with you and tend to any needs or concerns you might have or steer you to the better restaurants, bar, clubs, museums or points of interest in Montreal. This hotel is spotless clean and extremely comfortable, almost to the point where you don't want to leave your room. Breakfasts, which come with your accommodations, include Belgian waffles, croissants to die for, breads, assorted cold cereals, fresh fruit salad, yogurt and exquisitely rich coffees. You serve yourself, with some assistance, in a small but comfortable room located just off the lobby. Croissants and coffees are available anytime day or night and are on the house to all hotel guests. One bonus is the location on Rue St. Paul Ouest in the heart of Old Montreal. Here you are in walking distance of many fine restaurants, clubs, bars and boutique shops. If you like fashion shopping this is the place to be. It is a photographer's paradise if old world architecture is your thing. If you like fine dining at its best a MUST restaurant would be DNA located at 355 Rue Marguerite d'Youville, a few blocks walking distance from the hotel. I highly recommend it. Try their sage infused gin martini for starters. I highly recommend this hotel and returned again twice already.

Reviews.Title: “On second trip back to Le Petit Hotel, it gets even better!”
Reviews.Author: voldenuit
Reviews.Content: I last reviewed this hotel just over a year ago, shortly after it opened and the good news is that the hotel continues to outshine. One of the key strengths of this hotel remains the staff. They are impressive. Even a year after opening, they remain among the best in the business: attentive, extremely professional, helpful, and available 24/7, and they do their jobs without being overly solicitous. The rate we paid was about the same we paid last year, so this hotel remains an excellent value. Improvements I noticed from my last visit (and there wasn't much room for improvement): there is now an iron in the room, and the complimentary continental breakfast is now on premises and is very generous and fresh (especially the thick cut raisin bread, croissants, and other baked goods: in other words, they're not skimping here). Valet parking still a great deal and convenient (no long waits for getting the car back). Last trip we stayed in a room facing St-Paul, which was louder in the summer (although quiet with the window closed). This stay, our room was located further back in the building facing an another building, and it was dead quiet. Hotel-wide WIFI still free and convenient. As a former MontrÃ©aler, I return to the city frequently, and my wife and, at this price, I will continue to make this hotel our first choice when we're not staying with family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique at its best!”
Reviews.Author: lc2010Toronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Petit Hotel for a long weekend break to Montreal. Having read previous reviews we had high hopes for this hotel which were not only met but exceeded. The location was perfect situated central to the old-town with many top class restaurants on your doorstop. The decor of the hotel is modern and clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. One of the perks during our stay were the free hot drinks available to order from Le Petit Hotel's cafe (especially with it so chilly outside!). The included continental breakfast was abundant, fresh and tasty! Overall the hotel made our stay very relaxing we often found ourselves not wanting to brave the cold outdoors as the room was so comfortable and equipped (with plasma screen tv and amenities). One last thing to mention is the massage showers in the room with jets they were like a steam room which was another nice perk. If you do choose to stay here be sure to check out the Marche de Vieux cafe for quintessential French fare!

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brusheep
Reviews.Content: Attractive modern rooms consistent with web pictures. Walking distance to museums, shops, and restaurants. Free internet was a plus. Would stay again. Only complaints are: A) doors are thin so any hallway noise is heard in your room - only happened one night though and B) I arrived late and was confused by the parking options offered to me by the receptionist and so wound up parking far away in the Conference Center garage. It would be helpful if the hotel were a little clearer about the parking choices.

Reviews.Title: “MODERN, FUN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: fayeCalgary
Reviews.Content: Spent just one night in beautiful Montreal, for my husband's birthday. Chose Le Petit as we wanted to be in old Montreal, near rstaurants and shops. The hotel is ultra modern, hardwood floors, funky lighting, VERY modern glass/tile bathroom, quiet (even though there was constructioni next door) and a VERY comfy bed. Staff went out of their way to help us with directions, calling a very early cab and recommeding several restaurants for the birthday dinner - chose l'Original which was perfect! They even found me a charger for my Iphone - as I left mine at the last hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be more pleased...”
Reviews.Author: roriol
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in this hotel. We were immediately impressed with the modern appearance of the lobby. It was bright, hip, and inviting. We were even more impressed when we saw our room. I'm not sure if all the rooms were like ours, but it was much larger than we were expecting, and has a loft-like feel. to it. The view from our window was nothing more than a neighboring brick wall, but we were not looking for a view so that didn't matter. The free breakfast was very good and offered some of the best bread I'd had in years. The OJ was obviously not fresh-squeezed, but its a small place, I'm not sure how they could have managed that. There is no on-site fitness center, but guests at Le Petit Hotel are granted access to a center in a hotel right up the street (Hotel Nelligan). The fitness center at this other hotel in very small and much of the equipment needs attention. To us, the beds seemed too soft, but we like a very firm mattress. These are very small issues, none of which would not stop us from returning to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “noisest hotel I have ever stated in”
Reviews.Author: LouLou7751
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we were very pleased with our room, we did spend more money so we could get a larger room. The room had large windows that overlooked St-Paul st, and it was modern and lovely. The problem started at night. After going to dinner and strolling for a while we returned to the room about 11 pm. There was music and very loud voices, but that was fine since it was still early. When the shouting and reving of motercycles and yelling didn't stop and we were lying there awake at 2:30 this was a problem. We considered calling the front desk but thought that if we were wide awake the clerk must surely hear the racket. Then a huge 30 person street fight broke out we were looking out the window and it was a brawl, they were slamming each other into the walls of the hotel and they were in the ally next to the hotel. Still no police. Either the desk clerk was not at the desk and was sleeping in the basement , or this a regular occurance. We did not get to sleep till 3:20 and it was not a good experence.

Reviews.Title: “Small boutique hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Rrah17
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights with a group of friends. It is a quaint old building that has recently been renovated - great beds, lounge and an awesome shower. The front desk staff really went above our expectations - booking dinners - they actually went directly to one restaurant to confirm, really friendly and they sent us a box of macaroons when our room wasn't ready. There is breakfast of croissants, fruit and lattes included. The location is great for restaurants, bars and boutiques. The rate seemed low for how nice it was and it's location. There is a gym at their other property the Hotel Nelligan and rainspa at another affiliated hotel (massage with steam room).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent find - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Sue_n_Peter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June as part of a 3 week trip to Canada. From the moment we arrived at the hotel until the time we left, we were made incredibly welcome by the staff. They were always very helpful and recommended many good restaurants and would ring to reserve tables if you wanted them to. The area if very busy and feels very safe - we often went for evening strolls and never felt uncomfortable. We stayed in a small room, but even with our large suitcases we managed to move around and not feel too cramped - but I suppose you could say it was "snug". The free wifi was a nice touch as was the free all-day coffee. The hi-tech shower, with massage jets was wonderful too. Our only slight gripe was that breakfast could be a kind of chaos with coffee and juice orders having to be repeated several times before harassed staff eventually brought them and fresh fruit was often not quickly replenished, but this did not happen every morning. We had three meals at the Stash Cafe and were immpressed by the quality of all of them. The restaurant staff speak very good English and were very helpful with their explanations of the dishes on offer - and we were serenaded by the piano player each time we ate there.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, elegant hideway with five star service”
Reviews.Author: Krissy7777
Reviews.Content: My first time in Montreal I was nervous about where to stay and I was thrilled to fiind I made the right decision with Le Petit hotel. It is indeed petit but the design, elegance and comfort of the room are extremely impressive. I would however recommend a Medium room vs. a Small room when booking. I switched rooms after my first night in a small room and the difference was evident (and only $10 difference in price). What was the icing on the cake, however, was the staff. In particular Alexander, Sebastian and the young ladies at the front desk (did not get their names) - they were absolutely lovely and really went out of their way to ensure that I was taken care of! The staff is simply outstanding and as a solo traveler that made a huge difference. P.S. the bed was perfect - slept like a baby!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: TSchalke
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this small boutique hotel. Located in the heart of Old Montreal, there are many restaurants and attractions within easy walking distance. The Metro is approximately a half-mile away so that the rest of Montreal is within easy reach. Our room was small, but clean and comfortable (especially the bed). Larger rooms are available. The modern style and amenities incorporated into a very old building gives this hotel a very cool vibe. Breakfast was included and suited our needs very well. Special mention must be given to Alex and the rest of the concierge staff who were always helpful, cheerful and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet and cozy”
Reviews.Author: CR0726
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Le Petit Hotel after having spent the day cleaning our college student son's apartment. It was an absolute pleasure to find the rain shower, Aveda toiletries and soft, comfortable bed waiting for us. The room was modern and well appointed with an exposed stone wall. Wireless internet access was free (I hate having to pay for that). The continental breakfast included in the room rate was delicious with fresh bread, cereals, yogurt and fresh fruit and my husband really enjoyed the free coffee available all day in the coffee bar/reception area. The location is convenient to restaurants and sightseeing. Valet parking was expensive ($23 Canadian) but well worth it as the streets are narrow and only metered parking nearby.

Reviews.Title: “The Petit Hotel is well located, small, stylish and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: wardthree
Reviews.Content: The Petit Hotel was a stylish and delightful place. Well located on the most attractive street in the Old City, it is small and charming with an unpretentiously hip feel. The good looking and helpful young staff provided excellent suggestions for lunch and dinner and patiently gave directions to the Metro which is a short walk away. Our medium sized fourth floor room was simple and elegant in an artful modern way, with wooden floors, white walls and a sizable cupboard for hanging clothing. The bed was large and extremely comfortable. The continental breakfast of fresh breads and croissants, which they will deliver to your room, is delicious. If I'm ever back in Montreal, I would look forward to another stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Chic but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: moxandfelix
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for part of our honeymoon and we couldn't have been happier with our experience. We arrived later in the afternoon after a long drive and were immediately impressed with the hotel's tasteful, modern decor right in the center of Old Montreal. Very unique from anywhere else I have stayed and refreshing. The hotel staff were polite and welcoming, offering tea and/or a coffee drink (free 24 hours/day for guests), and when we got to our room it was clean and modern. The bed was extremely comfortable. The highlight of our stay here, besides the great location, was probably how helpful the staff were. They went out of their way to make recommendations, give directions, print out maps, and just make us feel welcome in general. The continental breakfast was fine. After comparing a few other parking options I would recommend the valet parking with the hotel if you stay here--they allow you to take the car when you need it free of an additional charge, and they let us keep the car there several hours after we had checked out while we did some sightseeing on our last day in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: xsparkleprincessx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at le petit hotel on a Friday night, in August. Such a beautiful room (a Lrg). The memory foam bed... soooooooo comfy. The room was super clean. Great ambiance for a romantic getaway in Old Mtl. We do recommend the third floor... it was relatively quiet up there. And, also, parking can be tricky. We opted to park at the old port, which is about a 10 min. to the front steps of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice and simple in a good way”
Reviews.Author: BTKass
Reviews.Content: I love a hotel where the windows can open, the floor isn't carpet and the bedding feels fresh Our room was really airy and open and the floors were a really nice bamboo which feels really nice and clean. The croissants and the coffee were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing First Stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: harpergully
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I travelled to Montreal for three days this August. Le Petit Hotel helped to make this experience a fantastic one. We arrived around 11am and our room was already ready. Although it is located in the heart of Old Montreal, the hotel feels hip, fresh and modern. The staff recommended two great restaurants: Le Orignal and DNA. We were in a convenient location and staying in affordable, clean, unique, and trendy hotel. What more can you ask for?!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Boutique Hotel I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Raychel99
Reviews.Content: Le Petit hotel won my award for my favorite boutique hotel yet! Staying all over the world and still was impressed by this gem. The most comfortable bed I have found yet, with a space age body spraying shower and unique style of the rooms. The service was impressive with complimentary speciality coffee, WIFI, and a quality breakfast included in the price. The location of Old Montreal was perfect but it just seemed we spent a lot of money on cabs getting to the Saint Laurent area visiting resident friends. Can't wait to stay again! Tried to book the next night we loved it so much but of course, they were full! Book early, leave happy and well rested!

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: Luigi1980
Reviews.Content: we staued at Petit Hotel for two nights in our Honeymoon. Staff helpful. The hotel is centrally located. The room was good but not so spacious. Very poor breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel...great staff!”
Reviews.Author: LKnussman27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 days during the Osheaga concert festival. It was in the perfect location (right in the heart of Old Montreal), was unique (an older building renovated with hip new features like fancy shower and comfortable bedding), and the staff was so helpful. One of the staff mentioned that it is a "hidden gem" and that is true. We drove right past it when we arrived! The continental breakfast was wonderful (fresh fruit, croissants, lattes). We stayed in a "medium" sized room and that was perfect for us as we were not often in the room lounging around...it was plenty of space. The room had a safe, refrigerator, and a really great hair dryer (yes, that sounds silly). So, it was the perfect place for us and the best place we've stayed in Montreal so far!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: john0952
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Le Petit Hotel for 3 nights in mid July. First, the hotel is modern in an old building, very well done! The room was great, King Bed and a fridge. Very well laid out and exeptionally clean. The breakfast that came with the room was much better than most hotel breakfasts. They even would make you a latte or espresso with your breakfast. Each night, they made us a pot of hot tea to take to our room. Front desk service was exceptional. Friendly and extremely helpful. The ocation of the hotel is perfect. It is on a main street, although very quiet. It is in the heart of all the tourist areas. Great restaurants all around the hotel. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great location, good staff and service”
Reviews.Author: Herbert&Zil
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the weekend at Le Petit Hotel in Old Montreal. The staff, especially Alexander, were very helpful making dinner reservations for us, trip suggestions, etc. The rooms are a little small but adequate, clean, modern with an massage shower. Breakfast was good with nice breads, croissants, yogurts and make to order coffee. The location is exceptional, right in old town and with easy access to the metro, walking distance to most downtown events. We went on a long bike jaunt and the shop where we rented the bikes was just a few blocks away. The restaurants in the area, and the staffs suggestions were all good. We especially enjoyed Gandhi.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cwa2006
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here recently on a two day trip to Montreal. We stayed in one of the nicer rooms, and we were very satisfied. The staff is very nice, very helpful. Our room was very nice (the pictures are accurate), well maintained and with a nice little view of the street. Breakfasts were great. People had complained about the noise, which I could see being a problem here -- if you kept the windows open. My wife and I had the air on and we had no problems at all. I did not hear a thing, though my wife noted she briefly heard some revelers outside at one point. Its a small street, so this is just a part of the atmosphere. I would note that we picked this hotel partly because everyone said the location is unbeatable. While the location is indeed great, the Nelligan and the St. Suplice are right down the street. But since the Nelligan has an upstairs bar on its roof (and it seems popular!) I think Le Petite is a safter bet. All in all, we were very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, friendly boutique hotel, great for the solo traveller”
Reviews.Author: sewexciting
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations of this hotel, after reading Tripadvisor's reviews. It met and exceeded all of them. Marc-Andre, the manager was most kind, even in his email correspondence with me before the trip. At late notice, I had to stay an extra night and he accomodated me beautifully, not charging me for the extra breakfast, when I arrived on his doorstep at 9am. My room was ready for me straight away, although check in was officially 1500 and he apologised for having to change me to another room for the remaining days of my stay. Each morning I would consult the staff as to the weather and the day's activities. Their level of interest and help was commendable. They would look up details, print me maps etc. There is no public computer terminal but the staff would help with any of those details, make dinner reservations etc. All the staff were very good, in particular Alexandre, Jennifer, the Ians and Anne makes a mean latte. I would highly recommend this hotel for the solo or duo traveller who like to do their own thing. It is convenient to the Place d'Armes metro, Palais de Congress (10 min walk), Old Port and Cirque de Soleil (10 min walk), many good restaurants and is in a picturesque part of town. It does not have any meals apart from a continental breakfast, however the staff will recommend many restaurants within walking distance or further afield. The rooms are spacious, I recommend the medium, although the bathroom is small, the shower is spacious. The pillowtop mattresses are better than my bed at home, the feather pillows the size of small clouds... Au revoir Montreal, a bientot...

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great staff”
Reviews.Author: Thistler
