Reviews.Content: This is a perfect place to stay in the old part of Montreal. It's stylish, convenient, increadibly comfortable beds and the nicest staff. Highly recommend it as an alternative to larger, impersonal hotels. Great neighborhood with restaurants, galleries, boutiques and the waterfront. Wonderful continental breakfast. Not easy to find, but a treasure when you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but paid too much during grand prix weekend :(”
Reviews.Author: xdreem18
Reviews.Content: The staff were super friendly and eager to please. Beds are super comfy. The unfortunate thing for me was that I paid a super high rate to stay here (over $400) due to it being grand prix weekend even though we wanted no part of that! We had the smallest room they offer and it was just a bit too small for us - including the bathroom - it was tiny. For the money, we got ripped! But for their normal rates, this hotel is worth it. It was a quick walk to the metro which we utilized and it was in walking distance to cirque du solei which is at the old port. Try it, but go for a bigger room and don't go for grand prix wknd!

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed I've Ever Slept In”
Reviews.Author: icecrystal87
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property two days after we got married. We came to Montreal to visit some of his family, and decided a little one night getaway to Old Montreal would be perfect. Though it was a bit difficult locating the hotel, we were delighted when we arrived. Our car was promptly taken by valet, and the desk attendant was more than accomodating. She recommended places for us to go to, since it was a slow Monday night, and even sent up a card and chocolates to our room when she found out we're just been married. The bed was the most incredible thing. I didn't want to get out of it and slept better than I have my whole life. The shower was amazing as well. The extra jets made it absolutely heavenly. We both loved our stay there, and would be more than happy to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, noisy neighbors”
Reviews.Author: Jean_alberta_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well-located, has a dedicated and helpful staff, and is stylish and attractive. Unfortunately I am a light sleeper. I asked for a quiet room and got one by the elevator, so I was woken up by people returning to their rooms late on the first two nights of my stay. I had noisy neighbors on my final night, and although the hotel staff tried to get them to be quiet they continued to party until well past 3 am. Maybe a different room would have been better. I will look for a quieter place the next time I am in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel! Couldn't have been better.”
Reviews.Author: Caples216
Reviews.Content: Le Petit is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in. My husband and I stayed there for our honeymoon and our experience was nothing short of amazing. When we first got to the hotel we were greeted with a warm and friendly welcome from the amazing staff. After checking in we went up to the room and were amazed at how beautiful and modern everything looked. It was clean, romantic, and cozy. Some of the other reviews complained about there being noise problems, but my husband and I even slept with the windows open and didn't hear a peep aside from the occasional carriage or car. Also, the hotel was very quiet on the inside. Breakfast was incredible....it has been about two weeks since we got back, and I still miss the wonderful croissants, pastries, and fresh fruit. The shower was spacious and luxurious. And last but not least the staff couldn't have been more nice and helpful. They were eager to make our stay as comfortable and fun as possible, with great suggestions of what to do and where to eat. When we first got to the room there was a personal note welcoming us and congratulating us on our marriage. When we checked out they held our luggage for us while we walked around old montreal until it was time to leave for the airport, and they even arranged our taxi ride to the airport. I would recommend Le Petit to anyone who wants a wonderful experience in Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room in the heart of Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: JellybeanandBug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Petit over the May long weekend for three nights for Cirque du Soliel and a concert. I'll admit that after I read the reviews about the noise, I was a little apprehensive. My fears were unfounded! Our room (307, "large" rooms class) was on the 3rd floor facing Rue St Paul (the "noisy" street). Our room had french balconies on two walls. When the balcony doors are open, you can definitely hear the party atmosphere outside, but when they are shut, you really can't hear anything. As for the HVAC noise complaints of other reviewers, the noise is pretty much on par with any hotel HVAC system. Let's get back to the real perks of our stay: the room. Our room was beautiful and spacious. Large desk, table for two, a neat chair and ottoman in addition to a king sized bed and flat screen tv. The wardrobe in the room had lots of space for our things and the bathroom was well appointed with a lovely rain shower. The rooms have exposed stone and beams, which give it a very neat, rustic feel juxtaposed with very modern furnishings.There is easily enough floor space to stretch out and do pilates or yoga, or to have an in room massage table rolled in. The included continental breakfast was tasty. Lovely croissants and fruit salad. I can't really comment on the coffee, as we are not coffee drinkers. There are also cereal options and bread for making toast available. My only issue with the hotel, which was minor, was the amount of time it took to have extra towels brought up. I was told the issue was the hotel staff needed to wait for them to come out of the dryer before sending them up. I wasn't too upset. This property only has 24 rooms and limited staff. The front desk staff were very nice and knowledgeable about restaraunts and attractions nearby. We were very pleased with the property and would definitely stay again on our next trip to Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “A place we could stay every time we visit Montreal...”
Reviews.Author: Canucknucklehead
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at Le Petit Hotel over the May long weekend (in Canada) and discovered that every positive review on TripAdvisor was accurate. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, furnished with quality materials and products, and arranged in a manner that makes you feel at home, yet also know that you can receive the benefits of staying in a first rate hotel if you desire. Although some services (spa, exercise facilities, etc) are not available on site. Having stayed in locales where water pressure is an issue, rest assured that this is not the case at Le Petit Hotel. Found in the heart of vieux (old) Montreal, Le Petit has it all: access to the Metro (about 5-6 blocks away), restaurants, shops, galleries, culture (Cirque de Soleil is a 5 minute walk), sights, history, nightlife. No, the establishment is not perfect, but neither are you shelling out multiple hundreds of dollars per night for the experience. On the issue of nightlife, mentioned by other reviewers, one has to realize that you are staying in the midst of a large, cosmopolitan city in an area that is attractive to both tourists and locals alike. While party-goers do favour the area on weekends, most everyone seems to be wanting, and having, a good time. Club or lounge guests seem to be there seeking a fun, social atmosphere, not to exclusively cause grief to visitors. All manner of people are out and about on the streets at night: teenagers, parents with kids, grandparents, etc. We stayed in a room on the 4th floor at the rear of the building and had no trouble sleeping - to be honest a second floor room fronting on rue St-Paul would be noisier. The service provided was exceptional (special thanks to Alexandre, Andre & Wesley) as the staff are interested in what you have been doing, what you are looking for and how they can make your stay better. They even tolerated my attempts at speaking French with good humour! On our last morning, the taxi was there 15 minutes before requested and they had arranged to put out breakfast early so we could have croissants and coffee to go at 6am. One evening we returned to find no facecloths, but that is my only minor quibble that was corrected immediately. If you want a 5-star where you are waited on hand and foot, by all means reserve one and pay $350-500+ per night. If you want a modern yet traditional boutique hotel that emphasizes the personal touch elements you might find in a bed & breakfast, I can recommend Le Petit Hotel. I would say it was closer to 4.5/5 than 4/5, but the buttons here don't allow for that sort of detail...

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the Old Montreal area”
Reviews.Author: bajanboy66
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently celebrated our first year wedding anniversary in Montreal. A very charming and romantic city with a great European feel. We stayed at Le Petit Hotel. It was as advertisedâ€¦.a hidden gem in the Old Montreal area. The service started out right as I called ahead and had ordered roses from a local florist. When we arrived at 11am in the morning the flowers had not arrived. The receptionist suggested we leave our bags with the concierge and take a quick spin around the block while she resolved the matter. When we returned an hour later and checked into our room my wife was totally surprised to she her anniversary bouquet and chocolates in our room. The hotel staff also recommended two great nearby restaurants that we thoroughly enjoyedâ€¦the Gandi an excellent Indian restaurant and Les Pyrenees and superb Spanish restaurant. We enjoyed our rooms which were clean and spacious. We had complimentary breakfast in bed and an assortment of juices, croissants and bread with some excellent jams. We highly recommend Le Petit Hotel with its highly professional and helpful staff. They ensured our second year of wedding bliss got started in the right way. Iâ€™m thinking my wife will keep me around ;-)

Reviews.Title: “We had a serious issue that was virtually brushed off by the staff, knowing we were leaving the country that day”
Reviews.Author: luv2fish33316
Reviews.Content: it is a shame the staff is so incompitent as the hotel is very charming.....there was a question about my wallet missing and the manager refused to check the CCTV recording. The "head" of group security was on "her way" for more than an hour and didn't turn up, probably knowing that we had an international flight to catch.....disappointing and handled very badly.

Reviews.Title: “There's something magical about Le Petit”
Reviews.Author: MsFear
Reviews.Content: We escaped to Montreal in the dead of winter. It was seriously bitter cold. However, we received the warmest welcome from the staff at Le Petit. We picked the hotel based on its ranking on TripAdvisor, which at the time was number 2. As my husband checked in and I held my two year old's hand, the concierge whipped out a map and asked if I was hungry and what I wanted to do. Within seconds she had drawn me a trail to a few local restaurants as well as an area with great shopping. We then went to our room where the Bell Hop showed us all the amenities, as well as the beautiful bouquet of flowers my husband had arranged to have waiting in the room for me for Valentines Day. By email with the concierge, Joelle, he had planned to have them waiting for me along with a card written in French. Joelle (as well as the rest of the staff) were outstanding. They made constant restaurant reservations that were outstanding EVERY single time. They even took care of our Valentine's Day reservation a few weeks in advance, recommending a restaurant that was kid friendly so we could take our toddler with us to celebrate the day. They even brought us coffee and a tray of croissants to our room about a half an hour after we checked in. And as an option, they will bring you breakfast "in bed" which means they bring up a mini continental breakfast to you. The coffee assortment is to die for and everything was really delicious. Any email we sent them prior to the trip was responded to promptly and always with a, "Yes, we can totally do that for you. It would be our pleasure." The warmth and hospitality of this hotel has me daydreaming about a trip back to Montreal almost daily. It's like a large bed and breakfast. They make everyone feel like they are VIP. The only small thing was how warm our room was. And it was easily remedied by opening the window. We slept like babies in the most comfortable bed I've honestly ever slept in. Even more comfortable than my own. Speaking of beds, they knew we had a little one with us so made sure we stayed in a room that had a separate area with a futon and made it up with a child sized robe on the bed for her. How could we not feel completely cared for? The housekeeping was incredible as well. It was immaculate in our room. I find it shameful people have rated this place down to 11th place. Le Petit can't control the city street sweepers or patrons of a bar down the street. They can't "take legal action" against people for being outside and talking. Have you ever heard of ear plugs? I can't wait to be back in Montreal to stay at this hotel. In my opinion there is none better in its district.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great location.”
Reviews.Author: jtmize
Reviews.Content: We just got back from three nights at Le Petit Hotel, and it was a great stay. The facilities are excellent, and the location can't be beat. The staff was remarkably helpful--specifically in making dinner reservations, giving us directions and the delicious breakfast that's served every morning. We were worried about noise based on some of the prior reviews. We stayed Thursday through Saturday (and during a Habs game). We had no problem with noise. Sure, there's street noise and HVAC noise but we wouldn't have noticed it if we didn't read about it in others reviews. Take ear plugs if you're worried about it, but it's really not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection at Le Petit”
Reviews.Author: melange1
Reviews.Content: From the moment a staff member met our cab at the curb until we left four days later we were in a world of service, ambiance and comfort. We went to celebrate a very special anniversary and everyone at Le Petit made our stay so memorable. We were welcomed at the front desk so warmly, even though it was a very busy time of day. Our room was not quite ready(we did show up early) and we were offered a cold drink or coffee. Do not ever pass up their offer of coffee here! The blend is perfect and we are very serious coffee drinkers. Once our room was ready, we were told we had been upgraded to a large room. A nice surprise! We were on the fourth floor in a large room, facing Rue St. Paul. The room was modern and cozy. The furniture was unique in design and color and the brick/stone walls added to the ambiance. We later learned just how comfortable the bed and pillows were...heavenly! And the bathroom was small but nicely laid out and the shower was incredible. Through the entire weekend, every request we made, every question we asked was taken care of with a cheerful attitude. If someone did not know about something, they got back to us quickly with an answer. It was as though we were the only guests...and the hotel was booked solid! When we asked for dining ideas, for lunch or dinner, we were given several to choose from each day. And their recommendations were always on the mark. When we finally chose the restaurant(L' Epicier...not to be missed!) for our anniversary dinner, they made sure we had a taxi ready at the door. Breakfast is included here and is not to be missed. The croissants alone would be worth coming to Montreal! There is also a lovely fruit salad, cereals, yogurt, delicious breads for toasting, homemade jams and marmalades. And of course, their wonderful coffee, and you can choose a specialty coffee drink at breakfast...a cafe latte, espresso, etc. And anytime, day or night, they are more than happy to bring coffee to your room. We cannot stress enough just how wonderful the service was at this lovely hotel. And even though this is a trendy place and may seem to cater to a younger crowd, we as a middle-aged couple, never felt out of place. We felt welcomed and catered to at all times. We do not speak a word of French and that also was never a problem here. The staff, even when very busy, always had time for a chat or to assist us with information. We would like to thank Joelle, Ann, Alexander, Phillipe and Juan for all they did for us! And we need to mention just what an incredible job the housekeepers do...the room was spotless each day. From reading other reviews of the same weekend that we stayed here, we need to address the noise issue. We are very light sleepers and do not like our sleep disturbed. We did hear the partiers on Saturday night. It was annoying to be awakened, but that being said, if you stay in a hotel in a large city, noise can always be a problem. The solution? Never travel without earplugs. We have travelled the world over for many years and noise can be an issue anywhere. Travel prepared and you will sleep. Especially in the heavenly beds at Le Petit Hotel! We look forward to our next visit to this perfect little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel - But You Won't Sleep on Weekends”
Reviews.Author: OttawaTravelGal
Reviews.Content: I booked Le Petit Hotel after reading all the wonderful reviews online and checking out their gorgeous website. I informed them in advance (when booking) that we'd be celebrating our honeymoon and once I'd booked, I emailed them looking for a restaurant recommendation but never heard back - fair enough. I saw how busy the front desk staff is! When we arrived, there was a gentleman in the lobby complaining that his room had not been cleaned despite the fact he'd been gone all day. It was after 5pm, and the cleaning staff appeared to have gone home for the day. These things happen, I guess. The room was as beautiful as shown on their website. Beautiful stone wall, fantastic shower, comfy bed, great aveda products. Bliss. However, all those comforts don't mean anything when you can't sleep a wink. Between 11pm and 3am, the noise was loud, but a pillow over our heads meant we could survive it (how romantic on your honeymoon!) By 3am, however, as people spilled out of the bars, the noise was absolutely unbearable. People were shrieking at the top of their lungs. Groups of drunken men were singing as loud as they could. And it lasted until well after 4am. By the time we finally got to sleep, we were awoken by the street sweeper (!) going by just after 7am (on a Sunday!) We learned, however that the street sweeper seems to go by at that same time every day. Or at least it went by on Monday morning at pretty much the exact same time. And Sunday night was also a party night, if a little quieter than the previous night. So all in all, it was a gorgeous looking hotel. The staff tried hard to make our stay enjoyable, but couldn't quite pull it all together (they were rather harried most of the time). Nor did they ever even acknowledge the honeymooner status. A simple "congratulations" would have sufficed considering I saw the email exchange I'd had with the hotel printed out with our reservation. The breakfast croissants were delicious. But nothing can make up for not sleeping. It basically meant we holed up in our room to try to catch up sleep during the day, but as another person mentioned, the lack of soundproofing meant that not only did we hear the unbearable noise outside at night but we also heard the people upstairs moving about, the cleaning staff, people going in and out of their rooms and the maintenance staff (?) making repairs or some terrible scraping noises. And honestly, I am not a princess, I've lived in downtown Montreal before and would expect sirens and some celebratory noises, but this was unbearable. If you can sleep through anything, I would recommend it. Otherwise, bring earplugs. And expect good, but not great service.

Reviews.Title: “Major noise problem - cannot recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dvkw
Reviews.Content: My company had booked me into the Hotel St Paul a couple of blocks away. My room there was facing a major road with a lot of truck traffic noise that bothered me, so I decided to cut short my stay and switch to Le Petit Hotel, which was on a smaller and I had hoped quieter side street. Unfortunately, I jumped from the frying pan into the fire. Just down the street from Le Petit Hotel is a bar called Santos that seems to be a bit too much of a hip happening place. There is loud base music from the bar itself and also noise from all of the people who hang out in the street to smoke (maybe banning smoking in bars wasn't such a good idea after all). And because Montreal bars close at 3 AM, this noise goes on past that. It is 3:20 AM as I write this and I am still hearing noise from the street. In addition, these people seem to feel the need to play loud music from their cars, honk their horns, and accidentally set off their car alarms after the bar has closed. Why don't they just go home? The hotel decor is nice, the croissants at breakfast are to die for, and the staff tries really hard, but the #1 job of a hotel is to provide a place to sleep in relative peace. While these activities are not their fault, they need to take legal action along with all the people who live in this area to get this bar shut down. If they don't, their business will suffer. After reading all the rave reviews (#2 hotel in Montreal), I was looking forward to staying here. Now, after this experience, I will never come back again. Unless you are one of the Santos partiers who wants to party until 3 AM and then come crash in this hotel, I cannot recommend it. Very sad to see such a nice little hotel with such great potential ruined by this.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Getaway Weekend”
Reviews.Author: limeyca
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a weekend at this hotel to celibrate our second anniversary. All our expectations were exceeded. The staff here are incredible, nothing is too much trouble to make your stay perfect, from taking our luggage from the taxi to making reservations at a beautiful resturant and every little detail in between. Breakfast was great, the room (Med) was fantastic. The location is perfect for Old Montreal. A special thanks to JoÃ«lle and the staff for making our anniversary a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely spot in the heart of Old Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: Cookie123_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, efficient, modern, luxurious and friendly. Great location. Thank you, and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: GulfIslanders066
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased when we arrived at the hotel. It was right in the heart of "old Montreal". The staff was very accommodating and helpful, both English and French were spoken well. The rooms and lobby have a funky look, everything is brand new. Great continental breakfast with fresh fruit. We would go back to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: NovaExplorer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel extensively and have stayed at many high-end hotels in our travels. We've attempted the random boutique hotel and have had mixed experiences. That being said, Le Petit Hotel ranks right up there with the best of the best. This boutique hotel has it all - PERFECT location in Old Montreal, wonderful amenities, and excellent service. The bed is wonderfully comfy and the shower is just great! We really enjoyed our stay, and would happily invite the opportunity to return for another stay in the future. Thanks again! A & J

Reviews.Title: “A Petit Gem”
Reviews.Author: scottishwestcountry
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Le Petit Hotel for 3 nights in March. The hotel is in the Old Quarter, surrounded by galleries and a number of great restaurants (we would recommend Garde-Manger which had great food but a little less formal than some of the others surrounding). As other reviewers, we chose to stay in the largest room type and were put in 208. This was a wonderful room with two exposed brick walls, a lovely big bed and seating a plenty. The staff, as others have said, were very, very helpful and we were recommended a number of great places to eat, taking us into other areas of the city that we wanted to explore, but would not have otherwise. The communal areas are what you see in the pictures on Trip Advisor: small but beautifully presented (more of a quick stop than somewhere you would necessarily relax for an hour or so, as in larger hotels). The only things I would change at Le Petit Hotel would be to have coffee making facilities in the rooms and also a guide for tv channels, how to work the wii, confirmation of check out times etc.

Reviews.Title: “A good addition to Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Steve_and_Megann
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Le Petit Hotel for a 2 day business/pleasure trip last week. We know that section of Montreal quite well, so knew where to look for the hotel. It is petit, but lovely, and could use a bit better sign-age in the front. Our room, 208, was HUGE. In speaking with the staff I understand this is not typical. We enjoyed the hospitality. The breakfast buffet was good. The staff were very helpful and seemed genuinely happy to be there. There's no restaurant, but there are many good ones in the area, so it's not an issue. We will certainly go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience and Great Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: JAKEandLUKE
Reviews.Content: After doing much research on what hotel to chose for my wife's b-day I finally chose Le Petit after reading such great reviews...Before I even booked the hotel I called and spoke with Andre Joly who was very helpful and answered several of my questions and sent me an email about their spa packages. Upon arriving around 1130pm I was met by Marc Andre who immediately welcomed us. I booked the largest room in the hotel which was a loft with high ceilings, trendy furniture and a comfortable bed. Unfortunately when we went to bed we noticed the room was stuffy and it didn't seem like the thermostat was working to control the air in the room. Sure enough when we awoke we were very stuffy and congested. I looked up and saw that the AC filter looked very dirty and clogged. The front desk was very helpful and sent a maintenance guy up and he proceeded to take the filter out and and acknowledge that looked liked the problem. After returning later that nite and entering the room it didnt seem any better. I went to the front desk and the gentleman was very apologetic and immediately offered me another room accross the hall to sleep in for the nite and to leave our stuff in our room until the am in which they would send another tech out to try and fix it. They seemed to get it working for awhile the next day but again at nite there was a problem. We decided to open the window and deal with it. Upon check out the staff was very apologetic and credited my account basically a free nite which was very nice. Overall what stood out about Le petit was the staff ...which great! They made suggestions on good restaurants and places to shop. There continental breakfast was great and coffee was outstanding! They even bring it up to your room if you'd like! ..After commenting on how good there coffee was they wrapped a gift bag up for me!..great touch!.....Anyway I would definately stay at Le Petit again and could see why there ranking is #1!!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the perfect blance of all things.”
Reviews.Author: jvodesign
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really loved this hotel - and we are tough to please on that topic. Each aspect of the hotel was a pleasant surprise: The hotel is quite new, yet it runs smoothly like it has been in business for years. It is small, so the service was top-notch, yet it is luxurious with all the right amenities from the room bar, the breakfast, 24-hour espresso bar, Aveda bath products, the huge glass shower to the cozy, comfy beds. The decor is hip and modern but is balanced with the exposed architecture of the original structure - very modern, yet cozy and very Quebec. The desk staff was terrific and as much research as we did beforehand, they always had the perfect restaurant or brasserie suggestions when we needed them and made all of reservations for those and for their sister spa 2 blocks away. We enjoyed the breakfast that was included in our stay. You can eat in their cute in-house cafe or have it sent to your room at no charge! Croissants, homemade jams, yogurt, huge bowls of fresh fruit, cereals and toasts. We may like to visit Montreal during the summer at some point and would not stay anywhere else but Le Petit Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Style & Charm”
Reviews.Author: travlingjules73
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Le Petit Hotel in Nov. We loved the hotel such style and charm. Location was great in the middle of Old Montreal beautiful and so much to see and do around the hotel we loved this hotel and the breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay at the Petit Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: christellefv
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Petit Hotel! Here's a bit about it... When I arrived at the hotel, the room wasnâ€™t ready. It is ok, I was early checking in. The staff was courteous and offered to keep my bags and come back a little bit later. The area the hotel is in has lots to offer... Nice little streets to wander in, restos (for example nearby "Assommoir" on Notre-Dame, very good), metro about 5 minutes away on foot, 8$ (plus tip) worth of cab to Ste-Catherine shopping street... I finally checked in a room on the 3rd floor. It was the small room and yes, it was! For one person though it was perfect... Nice bed, tele, writing desk, etc. But the phone did not work! They offered me to use one in another room until they got it fixed when I would head out for dinner. As I was heading out, I reminded the staff (new workshift) about it to make sure Iâ€™d have a phone that evening. They told me it was not easy to fix and Iâ€™d have to change rooms, but my new one wasnâ€™t ready yet. I just packed it all up and let the staff move my luggage as I was heading out for dinner. When I returned I was happy to see my new 4th floor room... It was more spacious! It lacked the character of the stone wall of the other room but had high ceiling, more windows and a bigger bed! Talking about the bed, it was so comfortable!! I slept really well each night! Usually in hotels I need earplugs to drown out the noise of the other guests/rooms/corridor... But not here! I think the hotel was pretty booked too... I saw people coming in and out of nearby rooms but never heard noises from neighbouring rooms. It was really peaceful! The best bed/mattress/pillows ever! I wanted to bring back the large pillow home! At one point a wheel came off from from my deskâ€™s chair. I left the wheel on the desk and the next day it was fixed. Things I would improve would be to add a soap dish in the bathroom... I didnâ€™t know where to put my soap bar so I just left it in the bottom of the sink all the time! I would also provide a little book in the room with the TV channel list, the breakfast hours, the gym options... The room was well-equipped... I liked the iPod dock (though the sound quality wasn't that great), the full-sized ironing board/iron and the powerful hair dryer. The mini-bar was well stocked. I didn't take much because it was quite expensive... Better off buying some supplies at the grocery store! Check-out at 5AM went well, the night staff was very efficient helping me... He offered to call a cab and helped with my luggage. I would like to book again for my next trip to Montreal (the Formula 1 Grand Prix) but apparently it's full already!

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable”
Reviews.Author: Travelor1Florida
Reviews.Content: The Le Petit Hotel is one of the most comfortable hotels I have ever stayed in. Iâ€™m a stickler when it comes to cleanliness and I have been know to travel with my own sheets, but at the Le Petit Hotel I didnâ€™t need to use them. The hotel itself was extremely clean and the guest suites and bathrooms were immaculate. I felt at home at the hotel thanks to the clean rooms, comfortable beds and friendly staff. I found myself wanting to actually spend time in our room and the lobby area to enjoy the chic and trendy surroundings. It was hard to find the time due to the fact that the hotel itself is centrally located in the absolute best area in Old Montreal. There were tons of things to do within walking distance (cozy coffee shops, fabulous restaurants, charming shops and great museums.) The helpful and knowledgeable was able to always point us in the direction of where we should go depending upon our mood. I would definitely recommend staying at Le Petit Hotel to even the most finicky traveler!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...”
Reviews.Author: gliserman
Reviews.Content: Nothing bad to say about this place. Very nice, comfortable room. Attentive staff. NIce breakfast. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “C'est tres bon!”
Reviews.Author: JoannaV
Reviews.Content: WOW! The hotel met and exceeded my expectations! We booked a small room and were upgraded by the hotel to a medium room! The room itself was a stunning combination of modern, sleek design and all the charm of the old stone building. The bed was possibly the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! The bathroom was small but clean and efficient. The whole space seemed very high end and comfortable! The staff was nothing but polite, accommodating and professional. The included breakfast was a typical continental breakfast, and all the pastries,fruit and accouterments were fresh and delicious (especially the croissants!). The price was on par with a Holiday Inn, but Le Petit Hotel is on a whole other level! The location is in the heart of all the wonderful amenities of Old Montreal and is very picturesque and charming. I went for an anniversary weekend and the room offered the comfortable and romantic feeling that I was looking for!! Le Petit Hotel was one of the most positive hotel experiences I have ever had (and I travel quite a bit). I read a review that complained about the lack of coffee makers in the room (even though it has a stocked mini-bar and mocrowave) but the hotel offers complimentary gourmet coffee all day in the lobby, and complimentary specialty coffees and espressos all morning. I think whoever wrote that review must work for the coffee maker industry or they are the type of person who is never happy with anything. The only negative thing that I could come up with about the hotel is that one morning there were no plates at breakfast (a situation which was rectified promptly). This is a hotel which is perfect for couples looking for a beautiful, romantic, comfortable getaway!

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: whiskeyback
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel right in the heart of old town. Do yourself a favor and stay here, you really won't regret it. The rooms are kinda small and simple, but you didn't travel all the way to Quebec to sit in your room did you? The staff was very helpful and polite, even to a stupid American that doesn't speak any French.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome boutique hotel with super friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: WorldBN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Le Petit Hotel in early October. The weather was a bit chilly outside, but inside this hotel, we could not have asked for more. This new hotel is carved out of an Old Montreal building with tons of character and charm. The rooms are contemporary and stylish but what makes this hotel great is the amazing staff - Patrick (hotel manager) and the rest of the crew. They sweat the details here and it shows. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great new boutique hotel in heart of old town”
Reviews.Author: David4758
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed by this hotel, and in particular by the staff, who were young, enthusiastic and eager to please, and helped to make it a very enjoyable stay. Our room were very modern and trendy, but also practical with lots of nice touches, and a very comfortable bed. The hotel is ideally situated for exploring the old town. The hotel doesn't actually have any facilities, other than a drinks area, and a breakfast area. The breakfast was really good, buffet-style and with plenty of choice. Only downside (if arriving by car) is that it's a very difficult hotel to find by car, due to the maze of one-way streets and road works, so we left our car 300 yards away, and the hotel staff were happy to go and put it into valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Will be perfect once finished”
Reviews.Author: JonandKarin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the "Petit Hotel" on our first holiday in Canada and it was a very pleasant experience. The location is excellent, in old Montreal, but not right in the noisiest part. The rooms are of a good size, not too small, and well appointed with a comfortable, big bed and modern furniture and fittings which contrast nicely with the brick walls. Small, but nicely decorated bathroom with a large, very nice shower. Breakfast was excellent - all food items were of the best quality and there was a great selection of fresh fruit (4 kinds of fresh berries, pineapple, melon, kiwifruit), yoghurt, good bread, bagels, excellent croissants (best we had in Canada), homemade muffins, jams and butter. The only downside was that the (very noisy) dishwasher was in the breakfast area and the staff systematically put it on whilst we were having breakfast which was very irritating. Given that the restaurant is still under construction, presumably this problem will be solved once the restaurant is functional, as we assume that breakfast would then be served there. A few minor hiccups: Toiletries were not replaced on the second day and the wooden floor was sticky from a recent treatment which was noted by the staff but unfortunately not resolved. The room lacked of a stand for a suitcase - which was supplied immediately when we asked for it. A kettle in the room would have been a nice addition, as well as folder with information on the hotel and the city. Overall, the "Petit Hotel" is a beautiful little hotel with a lot of potential. What currently appears to be missing is somebody who oversees the staff and works to optimise service. Staff are extremely welcoming, friendly and helpful, but seem quite inexperienced. With a little more attention to detail and once final touches have been added, it will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for a better place!!!”
Reviews.Author: JeanMiami
Reviews.Content: Incredible staff who was very helpful in giving us tips as well as always having a smile on them. If you are visiting Montreal and want a great place with a small boutique yet elegant feel stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and modern yet old world”
Reviews.Author: ERICBali
Reviews.Content: My wife a I stayed at the Le Petit Hotel in Montrel for only one night but could happily have spent longer.It is in the middle of Old Montreal ,nearby lots of restaurants and an easy walk to other tourist attractions. The hotel is actually a very old building sympathetically restored ,keeping its old charm ,whilst the rooms are very modern.Ours had a Queen size extremely comfortable bed with a large plasma TV on the opposite wall.The bathroom was super, with a large walk-in shower which had a cascade type spray.The only drawback was that there were no teamaking facility. The staff were efficient and very friendly obtaining for us taxis and a dinner booking and generally were very helpful. Breakfast was included (Continental ) and ther was a coffee machine always available. I can recommend the "Auberge de Napoleon" for dinner.Two minutes from the hotel and an excellent C$30 Table d'hote.Book!! . we paid CÂ£170 for B&B Eric Bali

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MThots
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay in the Old City in a particular Auberge which had been highly recommended. The Auberge was full and its operator immediately transferred my phone call to the "new hotel" across the street which was somehow affiliated with the Auberge. I was skeptical but our experience at Le Petit turned out to be wonderful. All staff is knowledgeable, pleasant and helpful. We had a "medium" room. It was comfortable, attractive and extremely well designed to make intelligent use of the relatively small space. As one example, the bathroom sink bowl was see-through glassLike the Auberge, the hotel is conveniently located to the restaurants, shops and Old City sights.

Reviews.Title: “A stunning boutique hotel in the heart of Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: BandeleZuberiPhoto
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've ever had the pleasure of staying in! A beautiful boutique hotel with style and panache right in the heart of Old Montreal. Lots of stuff to do within easy walking distance of the hotel. My room was fantastic with simply the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in and a brilliant shower too! Also free Wi-Fi, a large LCD Tv, ipod docking station, a safe, great breakfast, you won't want to leave. My stay was a faultless experience helped by the most friendly and welcoming staff who provided outstanding customer service. I didn't have a clue how to get around Montreal but they helped me every step of the way providing maps, printing off directions willing to answer any questions I had. They'd wish me a good day each time I left in morning and on my return asked me how my day was with genuine interest. I cannot recommend this place highly enough! PERFECT! I'll be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: plateful
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by the fully occupied auberge across the street. Turned out to be "bon chance"! The staff was completely dedicated to our needs, from transportation tips to providing fresh baked bread and croissants from their bakery supplier for our trip home. Our newly renovated hotel was stylishly furnished within the historical walls of this former wooden toy factory. The down filled bedding and pillows were the perfect ending to our daily Montreal walking tours and nightly food experiences .

Reviews.Title: “What a great little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steve233_9
Reviews.Content: Having no hotel reservations in Montreal we walked in of the street, What a bonus this is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. Just six weeks old, the rooms were very good and well equiped very stylish, and the staff were extreemly freindly and welcoming the free breakfast was another bonus. I can not recommend this hotel High Enough. Steve London England

Reviews.Title: “a unique gem in old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Louisine
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon this hotel, as the recommended B & B across the street was booked. We loved the modern decor and our teenagers loved the atmosphere, room amenities and location. Although the elevator and breakfast cafe were not working/open during our visit, we had a nice, complimentary breakfast at the neighboring Hotel Nelligan instead. We didn't mind the two flights of stair climbing. Our room was awesome and we felt like we were in Paris when we looked out our windows. The staff was especially friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ROSHSHASHA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. The rooms are fabulous and the staff were flawless. They were helpful and very very sweet and always made us feel welcome and special. It was very well situated and within walking distance to many restaurants and attractions (the staff were also helpful with travel advice). The lack of coffee maker in the rooms is so easy to overlook when you think of all the other things the hotel has to offer. The shower was also spectular. Our stay was very pleasant and this hotel only added to that.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I didn't have to share this gem!”
Reviews.Author: voldenuit
Reviews.Content: I remain floored by how well priced this hotel is considering what you get: a boutique hotel experience in the heart of le Vieux MontrÃ©al (immediately next to la Place Royale), ridiculously helpful and accommodating staff, relatively large rooms with luxurious linens, extremely comfy beds, modern furniture and interiors against a backdrop of exposed greystone, and well thought out amenities: hotel-wide wifi and ipod docking stations that were easy to connect to and use. I can only imagine that as word gets out about le Petit HÃ´tel -- it opened only a month ago -- that the rates will increase. This hotel ranks a close second to my favorite hotel in the area, the Gault. Our room was on the 4th floor and faced St-Paul, which can get loud on summer nights, but once the windows were closed, we heard nothing and slept without interruption. Finally, the staff were great. Valet parking was fast and cheap by comparison to other hotels. And the front desk staff were impeccably professional, thoughtful, and accommodating. Misc notes: breakfast included, but is offered off-premises, a couple doors away from the hotel. Ironing board in room, but call front desk for iron. There is no fitness center on premises, but my understanding is that they provide access to a 24/7 gym nearby (which I didn't use).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service and wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bzzz711
Reviews.Content: Within hours after being informed Auberge du Vieux-Port was booked for the five days we would be in Montreal, one of the hotel concierges at La Petit Hotel e-mailed me with a greeting and friendly note to let us know they had occupancy. When I called to inquire more about the hotel, Alexandre spent time to discuss my options and even sent me a map of the area within hours of our conversation. Throughout our stay, we were impressed with the outstanding customer service we received. From the friendly greeting to offering us espresso while they printed out directions to our next destination, we felt very well taken care of. Not to forget are the super comfy beds, awesome shower and wonderful decor. This hotel is truly a gem in the heart of old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Deserve poor marks in some important areas”
Reviews.Author: CDNAgeFiftyPlus
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveller, logging 100's of thousands a miles in the last ten years. I do know hotels. As the others say, it is a nice little boutique hotel, but there are lots of nice boutique hotels within a short walking distance and I'm regretting not staying at one of those. For example, in hotels of this class/daily rate, it is the norm to have a coffee maker in the room. FYI, there is none, not in the room, not in the lobby, nowhere. They told me in the evening that room service would be available starting at 6:30 am. In the morning, it is "oh no, we don't even have a coffee maker." With plenty of false apologies, their only solution was for me to go to another hotel to buy it. An apology would be acceptable if something wast temporarily not working, but I was lied to and the lack of a cofee-maker after being open for at least a month is by DESIGN. They are in-conveniencing their guest intentionally. They put enough money into renovating this place, why not spent the $100 on a coffee maker in the lobby at least or do like every other hotel and have a maker in the room, duh? As I said, there are some GREAT hotels in the short walking area around this one. Why stay here? Why encourage this kind of sub-service?

Reviews.Title: “I almost hate to give this one away...”
Reviews.Author: DaMota
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have chosen a better boutique hotel (26 rooms) than the contemporary Le Petit Hotel in Montreal's Old District. It was one of the most delightful hotel experiences I've had in my years of traveling. My boyfriend and I stayed for 5 days after it had only been open for about two weeks. Customer service was exceptional in every way. Warmth, welcome, and generosity abound. It is well staffed and every staff member was like a concierge. Each went the extra mile when it came to making recommendations based on our unique interests/requests, providing directions, printing information for us, helping with our baggage and helping us with our car, showing genuine interest in how our day had gone, etc. We hated to leave and wanted to take everyone home with us! Patrick, the manager was fun and friendly while still being very professional, and Joell, Valerie, and Anthony were exceptional. Anthony sent an extensive e-mail with lots of things to do and websites for more information. There were others whose names I don't recall, including a lovely young woman who looked like Audrey Hepburn. The rooms are immaculate, with bamboo floors, big screen TV on the wall, and the most wonderful bedding! You wont' want to get out of bed. There are little amenities like an IPod radio bedside with different nature sounds to fall asleep to, a shower with an option for full body shower jets for an all over shower massage, and a safe in every room for no extra charge. Because their cafe was not completed while we were there, they sent us a minute walk down the street to their sister hotel Nelligan for a complimentary breakfast which was very good. If you do decide to stay there and aren't big on climbing stairs, make sure their elevator is up and running. They were working on it while we were there. Part of me, selfishly, didn't want to tell anyone about this place. But I gave-in because this is a business that deserves to flourish.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Mich24
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the hotel manager answered our inquiry e-mail within hours, that was nice. When we arrived I was offered a seat and a glass of water in the beautiful lobby while they parked the car and checked us in. We stayed for three nigts, each of which were absolutely perfect. They brought us wine glasses, choclates and a beautiful thank you card. They were also a tremendous help navigating us to the best bars, resaurants and shopping!! Warm, caring and very helpful, loved, loved, loved!!
